intro: Airampoa tilcarensis, commonly known as the Tilcarensis grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Airampoa tilcarensis is often found in open habitats such as meadows and forest edges. Its ecological role includes providing forage for livestock and supporting local biodiversity.
